name: Split-Leaf Philodendron
climate: Thrives in tropical climates where temperatures remain steadily warm.
Prefers humidity levels that are higher than average indoor conditions.
Not tolerant of freezing temperatures, requiring protection during winter.
Optimal growth occurs in environments mimicking jungle-like conditions.
sunlight: Grows best in bright, indirect sunlight to avoid leaf burn.
Can tolerate low light environments but may grow slower.
Direct sunlight can lead to scorching of the leaves, causing damage.
Rotating the plant occasionally helps produce even growth patterns.
watering: Requires regular watering to keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy.
Allow the top inch of soil to dry out before watering again.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so drainage must be adequate.
In winter, reduce watering frequency while ensuring humidity levels.
soil: Requires well-draining soil rich in organic matter for ideal growth.
A mixture of potting soil, perlite, and orchid bark works well.
Soil pH should be slightly acidic to neutral for optimal nutrient uptake.
Regular repotting or soil amendment ensures continued health and growth.
toxic: Contains calcium oxalate crystals which can cause irritation if ingested.
Toxic to pets such as cats and dogs, causing oral irritation and swelling.
extra_care_tip: Clean leaves regularly to prevent dust accumulation and pests like spider mites.
Use a pebble tray or humidifier to maintain necessary humidity levels indoors.
